abstract: Amid a furor over corporate spending, JPMorgan Chase is holding firm on a $138 million plan to buy new corporate jets and a hangar to house them, ABC News reported on Monday.
snippet: Amid a furor over corporate spending, JPMorgan Chase is holding firm on a $138 million plan to buy new corporate jets and a hangar to house them, ABC News reported on Monday.
lead_paragraph: Update | 12:54 p.m. Amid a furor over corporate spending, JPMorgan Chase is considering spending $138 million to buy new corporate jets and a hangar to house them, ABC News reported Monday.

headline.main: JPMorgan to Repay TARP Money Before Buying Jets
